content.question: Matrices <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="A equals a 3 by 3 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 2, row 1 column 2 value 11, row 1 column 3 value negative 1, row 2 column 1 value negative 5, row 2 column 2 value 6, row 2 column 3 value negative 3, row 3 column 1 value 4, row 3 column 2 value 9, row 3 column 3 value negative 8"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="B equals a 3 by 2 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 5, row 1 column 2 value negative 8, row 2 column 1 value 2, row 2 column 2 value 10, row 3 column 1 value negative 1, row 3 column 2 value negative 1"><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. Which of the following is the value in row <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>, column <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> of the product <math alttext="A B"><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math> ?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
